laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial blood examination showed severe hypoglycemia at 1.4 mmol/L. After treatment, serum blood sugar level was restored to 9.5 mmol/L. Six days later, blood glucose level was recorded at 1.9 mmol/L. During admission, blood glucose measured at 2.2 mmol/L and fluctuated between 2.9 and 4.5 mmol/L.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood glucose levels were initially low (1.4 mmol/L), increased after treatment (9.5 mmol/L), decreased again to 1.9 mmol/L six days later, and fluctuated between 2.9 and 4.5 mmol/L during admission.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Hypokalemia was observed with a potassium level of 3.08 mmol/L.
FT3 = 2.53 pmol/L (normal range: 2.63–5.70 pmol/L), FT4 = 6.56 pmol/L (normal range: 9.01–19.05 pmol/L), TSH = 6.209 MIU/L (normal range: 0.35–4.94 MIU/L).
Severe hypo-insulinemia (<0.1 µU/ml) was noted along with a low C peptide (0.09 ng/ml) and low insulin release index (<0.002).
Low growth hormone (GH) level recorded at 0.075 ng/ml.
Normal blood routine, liver and kidney function, and tumor markers; insulin antibody (IAA) was negative.
